trans-unit.source: Represents a family of related fonts.
Initializes a new instance of an anonymous <xref href="System.Windows.Media.FontFamily"></xref> class.
Use this default constructor when you want to create a composite font programmatically.

This means that you do not have to specify a font family name for the constructor, but you must populate the collections in the <xref:System.Windows.Media.FontFamily.FamilyMaps%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Media.FontFamily.FamilyNames%2A> collections prior to using the constructed instance.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.FontFamily"></xref> class from the specified font family name.
Each family name that is specified in the `familyName` parameter can be preceded by a location reference to either a directory or a [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_uri](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-uri-md.md)].
The location reference is separated from the family name by a pound (`#`) character.
Multiple family names that are specified in the `familyName` parameter must be separated by commas.
Each family can be a real font that directly represents a set of font files that share the same family name, or can be a reference to a family name that is defined in a composite font file.
When multiple families are identified, the second and subsequent font families serve as fallback families, handling code points that are not supported by the first font family.
For every code point that is not supported by the first font family, each subsequent family is checked in turn.
The family name or names that comprise the new <xref href="System.Windows.Media.FontFamily"></xref>.
Multiple family names should be separated by commas.
familyName cannot be .

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.FontFamily"></xref> class from the specified font family name and an optional base [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_uri](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-uri-md.md)] value.

The `familyName` value can specify a relative [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uri](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-uri-md.md)] value, which requires a base [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uri](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-uri-md.md)] to resolve the font reference.
The `baseUri` value can be `null`.
Specifies the base [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uri](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-uri-md.md)] that is used to resolve `familyName`.
The family name or names that comprise the new <xref href="System.Windows.Media.FontFamily"></xref>.
Multiple family names should be separated by commas.
Gets or sets the distance between the baseline and the character cell top.
A <xref:System.Double> that indicates the distance between the baseline and the character cell top, expressed as a fraction of the font em size.
Gets the base [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_uri](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-uri-md.md)] that is used to resolve a font family name.
The return value is `null` if the font family name does not rely on a base [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uri](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-uri-md.md)] for resolving the font reference.
To retrieve the font family name that is used to construct the <xref:System.Windows.Media.FontFamily> object, use the <xref:System.Windows.Media.FontFamily.Source%2A> property.
A value of type <xref:System.Uri>.
Gets a value that indicates whether the current font family object and the specified font family object are the same.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.FontFamily"></xref> object to compare.
if o is equal to the current object; otherwise, .
If o is not a object, is returned.
Gets the collection of <xref href="System.Windows.Media.FontFamilyMap"></xref> objects.
For <xref:System.Windows.Media.FontFamily> objects that are created by using a font family name, the FamilyMaps property returns an empty, read-only collection.
The <xref:System.Windows.Media.FontFamilyMap> object defines which font to use for displaying a specified set of Unicode characters of a specified culture.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Media.FontFamilyMapCollection"></xref> that contains <xref href="System.Windows.Media.FontFamilyMap"></xref> objects.
Gets a collection of strings and <xref:System.Globalization.CultureInfo> values that represent the font family names of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.FontFamily"></xref> object.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Media.LanguageSpecificStringDictionary"></xref> that represents the font family names.
Gets a collection of typefaces for the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.FontFamily"></xref> object.
## XAML Property Element Usage ``` ``` ## XAML Values *OneOrMoreFontFamilyTypefaces* One or more of typefaces for the object.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Media.FamilyTypefaceCollection"></xref> that represents a collection of typefaces for the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.FontFamily"></xref> object.
Serves as a hash function for <xref href="System.Windows.Media.FontFamily"></xref>.
It is suitable for use in hashing algorithms and data structures such as a hash table.
An <xref:System.Int32> value that represents the hash code for the current object.
Returns a collection of <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Typeface"></xref> objects that represent the type faces in the default system font location.
An <xref:System.Collections.Generic.ICollection%601> of <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Typeface"></xref> objects.
Gets or sets the line spacing value for the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.FontFamily"></xref> object.
The line spacing is the recommended baseline-to-baseline distance for the text in this font relative to the em size.
A <xref:System.Double> that represents the line spacing for the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.FontFamily"></xref> object.
Gets the font family name that is used to construct the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.FontFamily"></xref> object.
To return the base [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_uri](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-uri-md.md)] value of a <xref:System.Windows.Media.FontFamily> object, use the <xref:System.Windows.Media.FontFamily.BaseUri%2A>.
If the <xref:System.Windows.Media.FontFamily> object was created without specifying a font family name, the return value is <xref:System.String.Empty>.
The font family name of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.FontFamily"></xref> object.
Returns the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Media.FontFamily.Source*> property.
If the <xref:System.Windows.Media.FontFamily> object was created without specifying a font family name, the return value is <xref:System.String.Empty>.
The source location of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.FontFamily"></xref> object, including the directory or [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_uri](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-uri-md.md)] location reference.
